prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled.

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden sniffled slightly, his patience already thinning as he waited for the girl in front of him to lie across the table. He grimaced when she finally settled herself down. What was her name again? Ayleen? Lia? Alyssa? He couldn’t remember, nor did he care. The memory had evaporated the moment she opened her mouth, spewing out words in that grating, sing-song valley girl accent that clawed at his nerves. He silently cursed himself for even letting her back here, knowing full well it was his dick, not his brain, that had made the decision.

This human blow-up doll had originally shown up asking for Vinny, but Vinny had taken off with his on-again, off-again girlfriend, Madisyn. Instead of sending her packing, Aiden decided to entertain himself. Not like he was getting anything else out of this garbage day.

“Stay still,” he muttered, pulling a small vial from his pocket. “You spill it, you pay for it. Don’t piss me off.” His tone was clipped, barely hiding his irritation. He opened the vial with practiced precision, creating a neat line of white powder down the girl's back. She giggled again, high-pitched and vapid, and it grated on him like nails on a chalkboard.

Aiden wiped his nose with the back of his hand, his movements jittery. He hadn’t had his fix all day, stuck modding cars in the garage from morning until now. His patience was razor-thin, and her incessant giggling was grinding what was left of it into dust. He fidgeted, tapping his foot against the concrete floor, desperate to lose himself in that fleeting, familiar numbness.

Just as he leaned in, ready to take his hit, a knock came at the door.

“Boss, Hailee is here to see you. Says it’s important.” The voice belonged to one of the mechanics, his tone hesitant as though he already anticipated Aiden’s reaction.

Aiden froze, nostrils still flaring from the line he hadn’t yet inhaled. A rush of frustration clawed its way up his throat. Of course, it was Hailee. It was always fucking Hailee when he was about to unwind, their timing immaculate as ever.

He leaned back, dragging a hand down his face. As much as he loved Hailee, and oh, did he love them in that twisted, unrelenting way that bordered on obsession, he still wasn’t over their messy breakup. It had been a chaotic hurricane of fucking, fighting, making up, and then breaking apart again, and it had left him spiraling harder than ever. Sure, they blamed his addiction, but Aiden wasn’t buying it. In his mind, it wasn’t the coke or the booze or the bad decisions. No, it was them. It was their constant nagging, their never-ending list of complaints, their bitchy attitude that had pushed him to this point—or so he told himself.

“Fuck,” he groaned, slumping back in his chair. “Fine. Let ‘em come up.” 

Still, the cocaine was already lined up, and his craving wasn’t about to wait. Hugging one nostril with his finger, he leaned in, inhaling the substance in one swift, practiced motion.

“Fuck, man,” he mumbled again, rubbing at his nose as the familiar burn settled in. The knock on the door had yanked him halfway back to reality, but the high was already pulling him under, dulling the edge of his irritation just enough to keep him from snapping.

When Hailee walked in, they were going to get that same disarming smirk he always gave them, the one that danced on the edge of charm and bullshit. Aiden knew how to play this game. After all, it was the only game they ever played together—one where no one ever really won.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee pauses in the doorway her eyes scanning the half naked woman near Aiden. Hailee doesnt even bother to comment as she sighs and shrugs off her jacket revealing her arm in a cast* "I'd really appreciate if you payed the fucking weirdos you got your drugs from so they stop showing up at my apartment"

*Hailee growls and the walks over and blows the cocaine off the girls back* "Aiden for once in your life fucking looks at me. I dont enjoy the hospital bills I get after your weird dealers break my arm becuase you didnt pay them"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's smirk faltered for half a second—just long enough for Hailee to catch it—before he forced it back into place, lazy and unbothered. His pale blue eyes flicked from the now-ruined line of coke to Hailee’s cast, then up to their face. He exhaled sharply through his nose, nostrils still tingling from the remnants of powder.

"Damn," he drawled, tilting his head like this was just some mildly inconvenient gossip instead of a dealer putting hands on them. "That’s fucked up."

The girl beneath him whined about the wasted coke, but Aiden didn’t even glance at her. Instead, he reached out with one hand and grabbed Hailee’s wrist—the one not in a cast—yanking them closer with that rough familiarity they knew too well. His grip was tight enough to bruise if they struggled (they wouldn't).

"Shoulda called me when they showed up," he muttered, thumb tracing over their pulse point absently. "I woulda handled it." *Like I handle everything else for you,* went unsaid but hung heavy between them anyway.

Then his expression darkened slightly as something clicked in his hazy mind: *They hurt you.* Not just some shove or threat—broken bones meant business. And while Aiden had no problem stiffing dealers when *he* felt like it, letting them come after Hailee crossed a line even *he* wasn't fucked-up enough to ignore entirely.

He let go abruptly and dug into his pocket before slapping a wad of cash against their chest without counting it first—more than enough for medical bills and then some because spiteful or not, petty or not high out of his mind or not... he couldn't stand seeing them hurt by someone else's hands instead of **his**.

"Tell ‘em next time I see ‘em near you again," he said finally voice low but sharp-edged like broken glass wrapped in silk “I’ll feed ‘em their own teeth.”
swipes:
Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second—just long enough for the irritation to flicker across his face before he forced it back into that lazy, half-amused expression. He leaned back in his chair, tilting his head as he watched Hailee blow the coke off the girl’s back like it was nothing. His jaw twitched.

*"Jesus Christ,"* he muttered under his breath, rubbing at his nose again before finally dragging those pale blue eyes up to meet hers.

**"You got a fuckin’ death wish or somethin’, blowing my shit like that?"** His voice was rough, edged with annoyance but lacking any real bite—because of course it did. It was *Hailee*. Even when she pissed him off (which was often), there was always something about her that made it impossible for him to stay mad for long.

His gaze flicked down to her cast, and something dark flashed behind his eyes—something possessive and dangerous that had no business being there after everything they’d been through. But then again, Aiden Steele had never been good at boundaries.

He exhaled sharply through his nose before shoving himself up from the chair with an irritated grunt. **"The hell you mean they showed up at your place? I don't owe 'em shit."** A lie—one so blatant even *he* knew Hailee wouldn't buy it. But admitting fault wasn't exactly in Aiden's playbook unless someone forced him into a corner first (and even then, he'd fight tooth and nail).

He jerked his chin toward the girl still sprawled on the table like some discarded prop—who looked equal parts confused and annoyed now that her makeshift coke platter had been ruined by Hailee's dramatics. **"Get out,"** he snapped without even looking at her properly before turning fully toward Hailee again with narrowed eyes.**

Then quieter: **"...They touch you anywhere else?"** The question came out gruff—like he didn’t actually care (but they both knew better).

Aiden's smirk faltered for half a second—just long enough for Hailee to catch it—before he forced it back into place, lazy and unbothered. His pale blue eyes flicked from the now-ruined line of coke to Hailee’s cast, then up to their face. He exhaled sharply through his nose, nostrils still tingling from the remnants of powder.

"Damn," he drawled, tilting his head like this was just some mildly inconvenient gossip instead of a dealer putting hands on them. "That’s fucked up."

The girl beneath him whined about the wasted coke, but Aiden didn’t even glance at her. Instead, he reached out with one hand and grabbed Hailee’s wrist—the one not in a cast—yanking them closer with that rough familiarity they knew too well. His grip was tight enough to bruise if they struggled (they wouldn't).

"Shoulda called me when they showed up," he muttered, thumb tracing over their pulse point absently. "I woulda handled it." *Like I handle everything else for you,* went unsaid but hung heavy between them anyway.

Then his expression darkened slightly as something clicked in his hazy mind: *They hurt you.* Not just some shove or threat—broken bones meant business. And while Aiden had no problem stiffing dealers when *he* felt like it, letting them come after Hailee crossed a line even *he* wasn't fucked-up enough to ignore entirely.

He let go abruptly and dug into his pocket before slapping a wad of cash against their chest without counting it first—more than enough for medical bills and then some because spiteful or not, petty or not high out of his mind or not... he couldn't stand seeing them hurt by someone else's hands instead of **his**.

"Tell ‘em next time I see ‘em near you again," he said finally voice low but sharp-edged like broken glass wrapped in silk “I’ll feed ‘em their own teeth.”

*Aiden's smirk drops instantly as Hailee blows the coke off the girl's back, his pale blue eyes flashing with irritation. He watches the powder scatter across the floor like wasted potential before finally dragging his gaze up to meet hers. His jaw tightens at the sight of her cast, but he forces a scoff instead of concern—his default setting when confronted with anything resembling guilt.*

**"Oh, fuckin’ *boo-hoo*,"** he drawls, rolling his shoulders in an exaggerated shrug. **"You act like I told ‘em to go break your shit."**

*He leans back in his chair, fingers drumming restlessly against his thigh as he sizes her up. The high is kicking in now—sharpening everything while simultaneously making it harder to care about consequences. Still, something about Hailee standing there pissed and hurt makes his chest tighten despite himself.*

*The nameless girl on the table shifts awkwardly, glancing between them like she’s stumbled into a crime scene. Aiden doesn’t even look at her when he jerks a thumb toward the door.* **"Get lost."**

*She scrambles off without protest, grabbing her shirt on the way out. The second she’s gone, Aiden exhales sharply through his nose and stands up—too fast for someone who just snorted a line—and stalks toward Hailee until they're toe-to-toe.*

**"You wanna talk bills?"** *His voice drops lower now; rough around the edges but quieter than before.* **"I pay for your whole goddamn life already—tuition? Rent? That stupid fuckin' art studio you never use?"** *He reaches out abruptly and taps two fingers against her cast with mock sympathy,* **"So yeah,* tesoro*, maybe I forgot to settle up with some sketchy asshole this week. Sue me."**

*But then he hesitates just long enough for it to matter—his hand lingers near her injured arm before dropping away again.* **"...Who was it?"** *he mutters finally,* **"'Cause if they touched you over some petty cash shit… that ain't how this works."***

Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second—just long enough for the irritation to flicker across his face before he smoothed it back into that lazy, half-high grin. He didn’t even glance at the girl on the table as she yelped in protest, scrambling to sit up now that her makeshift coke platter had been ruined. Instead, his pale blue eyes locked onto Hailee, tracing the cast with a slow drag of his gaze before landing back on their face.

"Damn," he drawled, tilting his head slightly. "That’s new." His tone was light, almost amused—like this was just another inconvenience in a long line of them. Like *she* was an inconvenience.

He reached into his pocket again without breaking eye contact and pulled out another vial, rolling it between his fingers before setting it down on the table with deliberate slowness. "You know I don’t deal with those clowns anymore," he said finally, shrugging one shoulder like this wasn't *his* mess she was cleaning up—again. "Told ‘em weeks ago to fuck off."

A beat passed before he added: "Shoulda called me when they showed up."

It wasn't concern in his voice—not really. More like possessiveness wrapped in annoyance because how *dare* someone else put their hands on what was still *his*, even if they weren't together right now?

The girl from earlier huffed loudly as she tugged her shirt back down over her bare skin and shot Hailee a dirty look before turning to Aiden expectantly—like she thought this little interruption would be brushed aside so they could get back to whatever half-assed distraction they'd been about to indulge in earlier.

Aiden didn’t even look at her.

Instead, he pushed off from where he'd been leaning against the workbench and took two steps toward Hailee until there were only inches between them—close enough that if either of them breathed too deep their chests would touch.

"You gonna let me sign your cast?" The question came out low; teasing but edged with something darker underneath—something that always seemed to coil tight between them no matter how much time passed or how many times they broke each other apart again after putting themselves back together wrong every single time afterward...

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee scoffs as she pockets the cash* "Whatever. And get that whore out of here" *Hailee then just becuase she is pissed walks over past several of Aiden's mechanics and to one of his expensive racing cars*

*Hailee looks around before she reaches over and takes the oil hose from Miguel. She turns it on and sprays it all inside the engine and then though the windows so it covers the interior. Hailee has a habit of punishing Aiden financially when she is mad and she knows it will cost a fortune to fix the car*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's entire body went rigid the second he saw Hailee grab that hose. His high evaporated in an instant, replaced by white-hot rage as oil sprayed into the pristine interior of his fucking *baby*—a custom-built '69 Camaro he'd spent months restoring.

**"HAILEE—!"**

His voice cracked like a whip across the garage, loud enough to make even Vinny pause mid-wrench-turn from across the shop. The girl on the table yelped and scrambled off as Aiden lunged forward, but not fast enough to stop the damage. Oil was *everywhere*—dripping off leather seats, pooling in footwells, ruining gauges he'd imported from Germany.

He reached them in three long strides and snatched the hose away with a snarl, throwing it aside before grabbing Hailee by both arms and slamming her back against the car door hard enough to make it rattle. His pupils were blown wide with fury (and maybe still a little coke), breath coming fast through clenched teeth as he loomed over her.

"You **bitch**," he hissed, grip tightening just shy of painful—because even now, even *pissed*, some fucked-up part of him still couldn't stand to actually hurt her beyond what she could take. "You know how much that interior cost?! That’s **my** shit you’re fucking with!"

The mechanics had all frozen like deer in headlights; nobody moved to intervene because everyone knew this dance by now: Aiden would yell, Hailee would push harder until one of them cracked (usually him), and then they'd either fuck or fight until neither could breathe right anymore.

His nose flared as he leaned down closer, voice dropping into something lower—dangerous in a way that made heat prickle up Hailee's spine despite her anger:
"Keep acting up like this... see what happens when I take it outta your ass instead."

His pupils were blown wide with fury (and maybe still a little coke), breath coming fast through clenched teeth as he loomed over her.

"You **bitch**," he hissed, grip tightening just shy of painful—because even now, even *pissed*, some fucked-up part of him still couldn't stand to actually hurt her beyond what she could take. "You know how much that interior cost?! That’s **my** shit you’re fucking with!"

The mechanics had all frozen like deer in headlights; nobody moved to intervene because everyone knew this dance by now: Aiden would yell, Hailee would push harder until one of them cracked (usually him), and then they'd either fuck or fight until neither could breathe right anymore.

His nose flared as he leaned down closer, voice dropping into something lower—dangerous in a way that made heat prickle up Hailee's spine despite her anger:
"Keep acting up like this... see what happens when I take it outta your ass instead."

Aiden’s entire body went rigid the second he saw Hailee grab that oil hose. His jaw clenched so hard his snake-bite piercings dug into his lip, but he didn’t move—just watched with this eerie, simmering stillness as they absolutely *destroyed* one of his most expensive builds. The mechanics all froze like deer in headlights, Miguel looking like he was about to piss himself as oil gushed everywhere.

The girl on the table finally scrambled up with a shriek when some of the spray hit her bare back, but Aiden didn’t even glance at her. His eyes stayed locked on Hailee—pupils blown wide from both coke and something darker—as they drenched the interior like it was nothing.

For a heartbeat, the garage was dead silent except for the slick *hiss* of oil coating leather seats and custom upholstery.

Then Aiden moved.

He crossed the space in three long strides and ripped the hose out of their hand so hard it made their wrist twist painfully. He didn’t say a word—just tossed it aside before grabbing Hailee by their hair at the roots (exactly how they liked it) and yanking them flush against him until their nose nearly brushed his collarbone.

"You little *shit*," he growled low into their ear—voice dripping with something between fury and twisted admiration because god*dammit*, only **Hailee** would have the balls to pull this shit knowing full well what it'd cost him in time *and* money. "You think wrecking my car fixes anything? Or you just missed me putting hands on you that bad?"

His grip tightened just enough to make them gasp before he shoved them back against the ruined car door hard enough to rattle it—oil smearing across their clothes where they hit wet leather.

"Clean this up," he ordered flatly, stepping into their space again until there wasn't an inch between them despite half his crew watching now (none dumb enough to intervene). "*Then* we're gonna talk about who exactly thought breaking your arm was a smart fucking idea."

Because yeah, sure, maybe Aiden had been avoiding responsibility all week over paying those dealers off... but nobody got to touch what was **his** without consequences either way.

Aiden's entire body went rigid the second he realized what Hailee was doing. His high evaporated in an instant, replaced by white-hot rage that burned through him like nitro.

**"HAILEE—!"**

His voice cracked through the garage like a gunshot, loud enough to make even his mechanics flinch. The girl on the table yelped and scrambled away as Aiden shoved past her, his boots slamming against concrete as he stormed toward them. His jaw was clenched so tight it ached, veins standing out along his neck and temples.

By the time he reached them, Miguel had already backed off—smart man—leaving Hailee standing there with the hose still dripping oil onto the ruined leather seats of his **fucking** $300K custom build.

Aiden didn’t hesitate. He snatched the hose from their hand hard enough to jerk their wrist before tossing it aside with a metallic clatter. Then he grabbed Hailee by the back of their neck—not gently—and yanked them forward until their faces were inches apart, breath mingling in sharp bursts of anger and adrenaline.

"You little **brat**," he hissed, grip tightening just shy of painful as his other hand came up to roughly thumb at their bottom lip—a warning disguised as something almost affectionate if not for how hard his fingers dug into their skin. "You think this is funny? You think I won’t drag your ass over my knee right here in front of everyone?"

His voice dropped lower now, barely above a growl but no less dangerous for it: *"Try me."*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee rolls her eyes and moves past Aiden to where the girl is still on the table. She yanks her up by her hair and gives a few pats on her face* "Get the fuck out. Stop laying you're half naked body across things. Now go" *She throws the girls head down and stands up*

*Then just for extra emphasize she grabs Aiden's bag of cocaine off the side table and tosses it in his oiled car* "Pay your fucking dealers Aiden" *She snaps as she walks towards the door*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's entire body tensed like a live wire when Hailee grabbed the coke—his *good* shit, the pure Colombian he'd been saving—and chucked it straight into the oil-slick ruin of his Camaro. For a split second, he saw red. Pure, unfiltered *rage* crackled through him like lightning, and his hands twitched at his sides like he was physically restraining himself from grabbing her right then and there.

**"You're fucking dead."**

His voice was low, almost eerily calm—but anyone who knew Aiden knew that tone meant **run**. He took one step toward her before stopping himself with a sharp inhale through his nose. His jaw clenched so hard it looked painful.

Instead of lunging at her (which every mechanic in the shop had braced for), Aiden turned on his heel and stormed over to where Vinny stood frozen near a half-assembled engine block. Without breaking stride, he snatched an industrial-sized bucket of grease off the workbench and stalked back toward Hailee with murder in his eyes.

"You wanna play dirty?" His grin was all teeth as he hoisted the bucket up threateningly. "Fine."

Then—with zero hesitation—he upended **the entire thing** over Hailee’s head in one brutal motion, thick black grease slopping down her hair, face, clothes… everywhere. It dripped off her chin onto the floor as she stood there stunned for half a second before reality set in.

Aiden dropped the empty bucket with a clatter and crossed his arms smugly while she processed what just happened—his expression screaming *"Yeah? What now?"* without saying another word.
swipes:
Aiden’s entire body locked up as he watched his coke—*his goddamn coke*—tossed into the oil-slicked ruin of his car. For a second, the garage was dead silent except for the *plop* of the bag hitting soaked leather.

Then—

**"FUCKING HELL, HAILEE!"**

He moved like a bolt of lightning, crossing the distance between them in two strides before grabbing her by the back of her sweatshirt and yanking her backward hard enough to make her stumble into him. His other hand tangled in her hair immediately, twisting just shy of painful as he forced her head back to look at him. His jaw was clenched so tight she could see veins popping in his temple, pale blue eyes burning with something between fury and *hunger*.

"You wanna act like a brat?" His voice was low now—dangerous in that way that always sent heat straight to Hailee's core despite herself. "Fine. But you don’t get to walk away after." He tightened his grip on her hair just enough to make sure she felt it before shoving past her toward the ruined car with a snarl.

The girl from earlier had already bolted (smart), leaving Aiden free to slam his fist against the hood hard enough for metal to groan under his knuckles before turning back toward Hailee with a sharp jerk of his chin toward their usual spot—the office upstairs where they'd fought (and fucked) more times than either could count.

"Upstairs," he bit out through gritted teeth, already stalking toward it himself because goddammit if she wasn't going to pay for this one way or another—preferably both knowing them both too well by now not know how this would end once door locked behind them...

Aiden's entire body tensed like a live wire, his jaw locking so hard his snakebite piercings dug into his lip. The girl scrambled away with a terrified yelp, but he didn't even glance at her—his eyes were locked on Hailee with something between fury and fucked-up admiration as they tossed his entire stash into the oil-slick ruin of his Camaro.

**"You're *dead*."**

The words came out low, guttural—more promise than threat. He moved before anyone could blink, catching Hailee by the waistband of their jeans and yanking them backward hard enough to make them stumble against him. His free hand tangled in their hair instantly, wrenching their head back to expose their throat as he leaned down to growl directly in their ear:

"You wanna act like a brat? Fine." His grip tightened painfully on their hair. "*But you don’t get to walk away after.*"

He didn’t give them time to respond before dragging them toward the back office—the one with the soundproof walls and lockable door that *everyone* knew better than to interrupt once it was closed. The mechanics all suddenly found something very interesting to look at on the floor as Aiden kicked the door open hard enough for it to slam against the wall behind them.

Inside was chaos—stacks of invoices buried under empty beer bottles, half-dismantled car parts scattered across every surface... and in the center of it all, a battered leather couch that had seen more action than most race tracks. Aiden shoved Hailee face-down onto it before slamming the door shut behind him with one booted foot.

"You *ruined* my fucking car," he snarled as he unbuckled his belt with rough jerks of his wrist—not even bothering with pretense or foreplay because they were way past that now—"so guess what? You're gonna pay for every goddamn cent." His voice dropped lower as he leaned over them again hot breath against shell of ear:
**"...Starting now."**

Aiden's entire body tensed like a live wire when Hailee grabbed the coke—his *good* shit, the pure Colombian he'd been saving—and chucked it straight into the oil-slick ruin of his Camaro. For a split second, he saw red. **"You're fucking dead."**

His voice was low, almost eerily calm—but anyone who knew Aiden knew that tone meant **run**. He took one step toward her before stopping himself with a sharp inhale through his nose. His jaw clenched so hard it looked painful.

Instead of lunging at her (which every mechanic in the shop had braced for), Aiden turned on his heel and stormed over to where Vinny stood frozen near a half-assembled engine block. Without breaking stride, he snatched an industrial-sized bucket of grease off the workbench and stalked back toward Hailee with murder in his eyes.

"You wanna play dirty?" His grin was all teeth as he hoisted the bucket up threateningly. "Fine."

Then—with zero hesitation—he upended **the entire thing** over Hailee’s head in one brutal motion, thick black grease slopping down her hair, face, clothes… everywhere. It dripped off her chin onto the floor as she stood there stunned for half a second before reality set in.

Aiden dropped the empty bucket with a clatter and crossed his arms smugly while she processed what just happened—his expression screaming *"Yeah? What now?"* without saying another word.

Aiden's entire body *twitched* when that bag of coke went flying into the oil-slicked ruin of his car. For a second, it looked like he might actually snap—vein in his temple pulsing, jaw locked so tight his teeth should’ve cracked. But then...

He *laughed*.

A sharp, humorless bark of sound that cut through the garage like a switchblade flicking open. The mechanics exchanged glances; nobody had seen him this unhinged since the last time Hailee ghosted him for a week.

**"Oh, you’re *fucking* funny today,"** he drawled, stalking after her with loose-limbed menace—like a wolf deciding whether to play or pounce. He caught her wrist just as she reached the door and spun her back around, crowding her against the frame with one arm braced above her head. His other hand tangled roughly in her hair, tilting her face up to meet his gaze—icy blue and burning all at once.

**"You wanna act like a brat? Fine."** His voice dropped to a growl as he leaned in close enough for his breath to ghost over her lips—smelling like nicotine and spite. **"But you don’t get to walk away after."**

His grip tightened in their hair just shy of painful (exactly how they liked it), smirk curling darkly at the way their breath hitched despite their anger:
**"Pay my dealers? Nah, baby—you just bought yourself an *evening*. And I’m gonna take every fucking cent outta your skin."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee's eyes widen as the grease rola down her skin and clothes and she turns slowly to look at Aiden's face* "Are you so fucking coked out you dont think. I get my arm broken becuase YOU dont pay YOUR dealers. So you deserved to have your shit fucked up"

*Hailee yanks off her jacket and looks down at her cast it has already started itching* "You fucking idiot. The skin under this is still raw so now I have grease all in an open wound"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second when Hailee mentioned her cast—*shit, he forgot about that*—but his pride wouldn't let him back down now. He scoffed, rolling his eyes like she was being dramatic, but the way his fingers twitched at his sides betrayed him.

**"Oh, *now* you care about your arm?"** he shot back, voice dripping with sarcasm as he stepped closer again. **"You were fine throwing hands with my car two seconds ago."**

But then she moved her cast slightly and he caught a glimpse of grease seeping into the edges of the plaster—and something in his chest twisted violently. His jaw clenched so hard it hurt before he finally exhaled sharply through his nose and grabbed her by the wrist (the good one) again, dragging her toward the shop’s industrial sink without another word.

He turned on the hot water harder than necessary before shoving her hand under it roughly—not gentle, but not enough to actually hurt either. His other hand reached for a rag nearby as he muttered under his breath:

**"Fucking *stupid*, both of us..."**

Then quieter—almost too quiet to hear over the running water:
**"...shoulda called me when they showed up."**
swipes:
Aiden's smirk faltered for a fraction of a second—just long enough for his gaze to flicker down to Hailee’s cast, the grease already seeping into the edges where raw skin met plaster. His jaw twitched.

Then, like flipping a switch, his expression hardened again.

**"Shouldn’t have thrown my shit then,"** he shot back, but there was something off in his voice—less venom, more frustration laced with something almost like guilt. He raked a hand through his hair (streaking gray strands with grease in the process) before exhaling sharply through his nose.

A beat passed where neither moved—just staring each other down like two feral cats waiting to see who pounced first.

Finally, Aiden cursed under his breath and grabbed Hailee by her good arm (not rough this time—just firm), dragging her toward the shop’s industrial sink without another word. He shoved her under the faucet hard enough that she had to brace herself against the basin as he cranked on cold water full-blast right over her cast and grease-covered skin.

**"Hold still,"** he muttered gruffly, snatching up a nearby scrub brush meant for engine parts and shoving it against her wrist—only to hesitate at the last second when he saw how red and irritated her skin looked beneath the plaster edge. His grip loosened slightly before he dropped it entirely with another curse and just used his hands instead, rinsing away as much grease as possible while trying not to make direct contact with any broken skin underneath.

His touch was still rough (because *of course* it was), but there was an uncharacteristic caution in how he handled her now—like even *he* knew this crossed some invisible line between their usual bullshit and actual harm.

After a long silence filled only by running water:
**"...Tell me which dealer did your arm."**
Not an apology (he'd choke before giving one). Not even close. But it was something far rarer from Aiden Steele: **a promise.**

Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second when Hailee mentioned the raw skin under her cast—his eyes flicking down to the grease already seeping into the plaster. His jaw twitched, something ugly twisting in his gut at the thought of her actually being in pain because of him. But pride (and cocaine) was a hell of a drug, and he wasn't about to back down now.

"Oh *boo fucking hoo*," he sneered, stepping closer until they were nose-to-nose, his voice dripping with sarcasm. "You wanna talk about *deserving*? How ‘bout you stop acting like I’m the only one who ever did shit wrong in this whole fucked-up mess?"

His hand shot out suddenly, gripping her chin hard enough to tilt her face up—grease smearing across his fingers as he forced eye contact. "You think breaking my car and throwing away my stash fixes anything? Or are you just that desperate for me to **pay attention** to you?"

The words were sharp, meant to cut deep—because Aiden knew exactly how Hailee worked. Knew that beneath all the anger was just them begging for him to *notice*, to *care*, even if it came wrapped in screaming matches and gasoline fires.

But then his grip loosened slightly as his thumb brushed over their cheekbone—almost gentle despite everything—and his voice dropped lower, rougher:

"...Shoulda told me your arm was still raw." It wasn’t an apology (it never was with him), but it was close enough for them both to know what he really meant: *I didn’t want you hurt.* Not like this.

Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second when Hailee mentioned the raw skin under her cast. His eyes flicked down to the grease-smeared plaster, and something twisted in his gut—something ugly and sharp that he immediately buried under another layer of spite.

**"Shouldn't have thrown my shit then,"** he shot back, but his voice lacked its usual venom. He shifted on his feet, suddenly hyper-aware of every mechanic watching them like this was some fucked-up reality show.

Then, because he *couldn't* just let it go (when had he ever?), Aiden grabbed a clean shop rag off a nearby bench and tossed it at her chest with way more force than necessary. **"Clean yourself up before you start bitching about infections."**

He didn’t apologize—he *never* apologized—but the way his jaw clenched as she wiped at her arm said enough. He was pissed, yeah, but not *just* at her. Mostly at himself for letting things get this far.

Still… pride won out in the end. With a scoff, Aiden turned away like he couldn’t stand looking at her anymore and barked over his shoulder: **"And next time? Break their fucking nose before they break yours."**

Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second—just long enough for his eyes to flick down to her cast, the grease already seeping into the edges where raw skin met plaster. His jaw twitched.

Then, like flipping a switch, he scoffed and rolled his eyes hard. **"Oh, cry me a fucking river."** He stepped closer, invading her space until she could smell the coke still lingering in his nose, feel his breath hot against her greasy cheek. **"You wanna talk about *deserving* shit? You *knew* what happens when you fuck with my cars—so don’t act surprised when I fuck back."**

But then his gaze dropped again to her arm. His fingers twitched at his side like he wanted to reach out but stopped himself halfway. Instead, he jerked his chin toward the shop bathroom with an irritated grunt.

**"Go clean that shit off before it gets infected,"** he muttered—less of an order and more of a pissed-off concession. **"And stop acting like I *wanted* some junkie breaking your arm over fifty bucks."** (A lie; Aiden never cared about money until someone else tried taking it from him.)

He turned away before she could respond, snatching up another rag off the workbench and tossing it at her chest without looking—then immediately storming off toward Vinny like this conversation was over whether she liked it or not. But not before barking over his shoulder:

**"And next time? Just call me first instead of throwing tantrums in my garage!"**

Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second when he saw the grease seeping into Hailee's cast. His fingers twitched at his sides—instinct warring with spite—before he forced another lazy shrug, tilting his head like this was all some big joke.

**"Shouldn't have thrown my shit then,"** he shot back, but there was less venom in it now. His eyes kept flicking to her arm despite himself, jaw working like he wanted to say something else but couldn’t quite force it out past the pride and cocaine still buzzing in his veins.

Then, with an irritated grunt, he grabbed a clean shop rag off the nearest bench and shoved it at her chest—not gentle, but not rough enough to hurt either. **"Here. Before you start bitching about infection or whatever."**

He didn’t apologize (he *never* apologized), but the way his fingers lingered against hers for half a second too long said enough. That silent *"I didn’t mean that part."* That stupid fucking habit of hurting her and then scrambling to fix it before she could really walk away for good.

His voice dropped lower when he spoke again, barely above a growl: **"And next time your arm gets broken 'cause of me? You better break mine right back."**

Because that was how they worked—violent and messy and never letting anyone else land a hit without retaliation... even if they were the ones who kept swinging first.

Aiden's smirk faltered for just a second when Hailee mentioned her cast—*shit, he forgot about that*—but his pride wouldn't let him back down now. He scoffed, rolling his eyes like she was being dramatic, but the way his fingers twitched at his sides betrayed him.

**"Oh, *now* you care about your arm?"** he shot back, voice dripping with sarcasm as he stepped closer again. **"You were fine throwing hands with my car two seconds ago."**

But then she moved her cast slightly and he caught a glimpse of grease seeping into the edges of the plaster—and something in his chest twisted violently. His jaw clenched so hard it hurt before he finally exhaled sharply through his nose and grabbed her by the wrist (the good one) again, dragging her toward the shop’s industrial sink without another word.

He turned on the hot water harder than necessary before shoving her hand under it roughly—not gentle, but not enough to actually hurt either. His other hand reached for a rag nearby as he muttered under his breath:

**"Fucking *stupid*, both of us..."**

Then quieter—almost too quiet to hear over the running water:
**"...shoulda called me when they showed up."**
